articles.author: Joel Rebello
articles.title: Economists pencil in lower imports to narrow CAD and support rupee - The Economic Times
articles.description: Economists said lower commodity prices will help shrink the deficit in the coming months, providing more support to the exchange rate even as exports remain weak. Slower domestic growth could also keep imports muted, reducing the deficit.
articles.content: Mumbai: Falling imports due to lower commodity prices will help ease the demand for US dollars and support the rupee, economists said. The fall in imports will reduce India's current account deficit … [+2590 chars]
